docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare’s five-year-old rating system to help families select nursing homes relies on unverified, incomplete and often misleading data.

headline.main: Medicare Star Ratings Allow Nursing Homes to Game the System
headline.print_headline: Ratings Allow Nursing Homes to Game System

docs.abstract: Examination of Medicare's rating system of nursing homes by The New York Times has found that many top-ranked nursing homes have been given seal of approval that is based on incomplete information and can mislead consumers; Medicare ratings, which have become gold standard across the country, are based in large part on self-reported data by nursing homes that government does not verify.
docs.snippet: Medicare’s five-year-old rating system to help families select nursing homes relies on unverified, incomplete and often misleading data.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawsuits by the City of Chicago and Orange and Santa Clara Counties in California contend that drug makers urged doctors to overprescribe painkillers, fueling an increase in abuse, addiction and fatal overdoses.

headline.main: Chicago and 2 California Counties Sue Over Marketing of Painkillers
headline.print_headline: Chicago and 2 California Counties Sue Over Marketing of Painkillers

docs.abstract: City of Chicago and two California counties file separate lawsuits challenging 'aggressive marketing' of painkillers by five drug companies they say fuel epidemic and addiction to prescription opioids, annually costing taxpayers millions of dollars in insurance claims and other health care costs; many people who become addicted to painkillers increasingly turn to cheap heroin when they cannot afford prescription drugs.
docs.snippet: Lawsuits by the City of Chicago and Orange and Santa Clara Counties in California contend that drug makers urged doctors to overprescribe painkillers, fueling an increase in abuse, addiction and fatal overdoses.

docs.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, Jules Feiffer, the cartoonist, playwright, screenwriter and author, packed up his drawing supplies and relocated full time to the Hamptons. The change in environment turned out to be a boon for him.

headline.main: Moving East, an Artist Doubles His Productivity
headline.print_headline: Moving East, an Artist Doubles His Productivity

docs.abstract: Profile of Jules Feiffer, cartoonist, playwright, screenwriter and author who experienced a boom in productivity after relocating from New York City to East Hampton, NY (Metropolitan/Long Island).
docs.snippet: Five years ago, Jules Feiffer, the cartoonist, playwright, screenwriter and author, packed up his drawing supplies and relocated full time to the Hamptons. The change in environment turned out to be a boon for him.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two books assess the state of public education and the realities facing instructors today.
docs.abstract: Sebastian Stockman reviews books Building a Better Teacher: How Teaching Works (and How to Teach It to Everyone) by Elizabeth Green and Getting Schooled: The Reeducation of an American Teacher by Garret Keizer.
docs.snippet: Two books assess the state of public education and the realities facing instructors today.
